review: good mv game
one of the greatest metroidvanias on steam id do anything for a sequel

this is in my top five games of all time it has a compelling storyline fun dialog and a great combat and movement system 100 would suggest this game  ps it is a bit hard for starting players so if you are unwilling to try twentyish times on a boss fight the first time then this may not be the game for you
i think its a great game there are bosses enemies npcs i recommend it play it see what you think and i just love it
good game

this feels more like 2d rpg rather than a metroidvania and the controls are messy but the combat is better than most if not all recent metroidvanias id say try the game just so you can have better expectations for combat in future games

dont really like when you get scored for combat while playing the story prefer that to only be in modes specifically for that disruptive stressful and annoying when you dont get the highest scores especially if it is tied to things such as rewards or achievements good game otherwise but it is just a thing i dont agree with enough to immediately give it a negative review

was having a good time then came the part to back track as one normally does in a medtroidvania and it turns out the enemies scale to your level tell me what the fuck is the point in even having levels when everything is your level you dont get any stronger a couple hours in at every single turn it takes 34 hits to kill something more if a boss not continuing 010 because no game should ever have dynamic scaling

disclaimer this is more of a mixed review then it is positive or negative  fairly solid metroidvania aged well imo but its def missing something couldnt be fked to start another playthrough different characters build etc feels like ive seen all it has to experience in one playthrough  its still very much so enjoyable but unless youre a die hard fan of the genre theres way better options out there
good metroidvania game with great soundtrack and special art style
great game fun combat
its a bit rough around the edges but i have very fond memories of my playthrough back then grab it when its on sale should drop to 35 bucks
a very beautiful wellwritten sidescroller with a somewhat unexpected mention of wintersun  7310

a fun metroidvania with just enough difficulty to be a good challenge a surprisingly amount of replayability with three other playable characters who all have their own skills and playstyles as well as their own backstories and dialog that only get revealed if you play as them definitely worth the price

im surprised this metroidvania isnt more wellknown or popular  the combocombat system just feels great especially given the variety of bosses you encounter  there are plenty of viable weaponsbuilds for each character that keep each run feeling fresh  the movement has a few quirks to it but once you get used to it it feels very responsive  the soundtrack is pretty solid too
great metroidvania with some of the smoothest controls ive felt in a while great aesthetics and collectibles make it a nice adventure
solid sorta snes vibes
its a pretty fun metroidvania
combat is pretty fun but the controls while platforming feel really clunky too irritating
a real gem that didnt get the attention it deserved ten years ago this made me realise the metroidvania genre was far from over of the whole postmillennial crop this stands right below hollow knight
game is so broken in slow motion that i had to refund
good metroidvania good animations good enough story good music good game
a hidden gem for metroidvania lovers
control is shit

really good but hard game a bunch of the bosses are quite annoying always teleporting around or blocking your attacks i started on veteran but had to restart on hard after getting to the 2 boss already
yes

a solid metroidvania with a fairly interesting story quality combat gameplay decent build customization a few small skilltrees to choose from and a mindblowingly good soundtrack overall its an 8 or 910 a very good game all metroidvania fans should play immediately
great game
the game is hard as nails but you have 4 different characters and a decent enough story the ost is really really good the only sin is not having the sequel
great mv

have to be honest this game is good but is a hard game enemies is a great pain for you to passthrough and bosses will combo you to dead if you make so much a single mistake so beware if you think you are a more casual gamer this game is not for you  but overall this game provide everything you want as metroidvania challenge ranking badass boss music unique biome a must try if you are ready

there is only one metrovania game that i like more than this sotn  4 characters with different types of builds pair with the ranking of boss battles grant a ton of replayability my major problem with this game is the map which is terrible but you can easly find it online to help you good soundtrack story and combos i could not recommend more valdis story
real hidden gem worth your time 910

first pc exclusive game i ever played i cannot recommend it enough as a metroidvania fan only complaint i have is the low level cap but given the games structure it makes sense give this game more love
good
play again and again to explore more
this game is really fucking good movementexplorationbattle system definitely worth your time
solid 710 game enjoyable in terms of visual designcharacter design and combat where it falls flat is the annoying enemy mechanics and placement as well as a rather dull world to tread through
awesome game since 2013 storyrich with meaningful bosses  each of them got their own stories finished the game with dark 666 alignment  chained punchkick combos
graphics are weird like from portable games not for me

a high quality game brought down by small design choices one would expect a game of this much effort to be more popular but nope the devs did all they could to make this as annoying as possible  for example enemy attacks will deal 5 of your health as damage but either stunlock you or push you into enviromental hazard that will half your health instantly  too bad because the combat is fun and not all effort is wasted

bit of an unforgiving game  not enough of things to craft all the great stuff so youre left with some tough decisions if you dont read up on it first you will probably not be able to beat the final boss on the first run through
not good
classic metroidvania with an emphasis on animation cancelling  fast combat highly recommended
the requirement of a perfect controller sucks  without the controller allowing you to do the quick ledge jumps game is impossible
valdis story is a vastly underrated game it has beautiful visuals and music deep leveling system and quite possibly the best combat in its genre do not pass up this one
lots of content pretty solid game
just a great metroidvania with fun combat
an old game but it still holds up dont expect some more modern amenities like a working world map or having quests markers but it is cheap

playing this now in 2023 it doesnt feel that good controls are a bit unresponsive the magic system feels a bit to complicated for this kind of game it is not complicated the visuals are just soso there are much better games in this genre to play

interesting metroidvania game here you choose characters you want to play as then you make your way through as you fight against demons angels creatures thats neither of them along with gods as you find your allies and escape from the place you are in its a pretty tough game but fair so it shouldnt ruin your experience i would recommend this one

is this a perfect game no its not but i would deffinetly give it a solid 86 out of 10 i have also replayed the game the grain of salt is that i like this kind of game metroidvania style arpg kind of thing lastly it has been years since i played the game so i cant remember specifically what bothered me just that i think it was ice related

finally played this years after hearing one of the stage tracksspecifically the frozen mausoleum legitimately one of my favorite games of all time now awesome art style and story music is amazing fun and varied combat loads of ways to build four different characters i highly recommend this experience
fun mv worth 15 dollars
nice 2d game
sick af very rich and variable content one of my fav
very nice good graphics and sound

a great metroidvania for its price 8 hours or so of playtime but there ae 4 characters and all play a bit different and start at different areas plus it has 4 or so difficult levels

i bought this game in december 2015  it sat in my library and i never played for more than a few minutes before this week in 2023  i am in love with this game it may be my new favorite game ever  i cant wait to see everything it has to offer it is just so much fun

extremely floaty controls make this game an exercise in frustration instead of an enjoyable action rpgmetroidvania  i dont understand the positive reviews the game feel can be described as doing figure skating on ice covered in oil and grease  yeah it came out in 2013 but even snes platformers had figured out precise aerial momentum controls what a letdown

valdis story is a hidden gem the skill trees weapon upgrades and four playable characters last many hours the story is vague but the lore is there this game is surprisingly challenging
assuming no sound issues great game

game runs great on steam deck at 60fps but have one issue and with gameplay every button press has a huge amount of input lag doesnt make gameplay feel smooth which you kinda need in a metroidvania game its to the point that i stopped after the first boss makes the controls feel chunky af i would def say pick this up as it is fun but this is gonna go into backlog and will try it again after updates if the input lag is fixed is only game i own that feels like this

clunky controls bad camera a lot of stuff not explained at all i managed to figure my way out and play it a bit but its more of a torture than an enjoyable game maybe the story is good but im not sure i will bear playing it to the end since its got pretty decent difficulty whats the point of difficulty setting if theres no easy story mode  well at least theres no fall damage

this is a good game to replay with different characters but the first play through is very unsatisfying with all of the missable upgrades and content read a point of no return guide and learn how s rank rewards and laurel work before you invest in a completion run

really great game easy to get into ost is legit awesome like 34 different characters and play styles replayability is great hope they give us a sequel

i avoided this game when it originally came out because the combat looked stiff but i really liked this developers other game fae tactics so i decided to come back and give valdis story a try  verdict the gameplay is really stiff it is unpleasant to control your character for a combatfocused metroidvania i cant think of a more important thing to get right

the movement is janky af and not remotely as smooth as the game expects it to be  like when you transition from one screen to the next sometimes youre standing still and need to double tap to keep going forward even if you were holding down forward as you changed screens movement is the most essential mechanic in the genre and this games just doesnt feel good at all

one of the best metroidvanias out there fun exploring 4 characters to pick from skilltress combat that feels rewarding a hidden gem and thats such a shame for a good developer maybe one day some influencers will pick this game up and give it some light
needs a sequel

top 5 metroidvania for me the biggest complaint i have is that it is too short

a very nice and underrated game the style and presentation is almost nostalgic and the music elevates it even higher the only malus is that it shows its age the platforming can feel clunky and slow i wish there were more options for increasing speed and jump and the graphics are low quality still worth it especially if you love metroidvanias

sound effects would get increasingly loud and crackly looked the issue up and its apparently been a problem since launch the only way to stop it was to disable all sound effects its not a game designed to be played in silence prior to audio issues had to drop settings to normal as high ran in slowmo not dropping frames just doubling their duration looked fun too bad its unplayable refunding and avoiding endlessfluff games in the future

this is one of my favorite games i really like the world characters and gameplay mechanics that this game brings to the table it is on the harder side but the game gives you the tools you need to develop the adequate skills to beat it and i found it really rewarding to do so if you have any inkling that you might enjoy this game please give it a shot
dying for a sequel one of my favorite games ever

this is a fun little metroidvainia 2d action rpg  its not terribly long but worth the full price tag of 15 us i really like the cartoonish art style straightforward dialog and story its really is an all around great title sometimes the audio is a bit buggy but there are tips for fixing it in the community pages so not that big a deal id say its a solid 810 game
